attributes.action: Government should be enforcing penalties on media outlets propagating fake News.
attributes.additional_details: Penalizing fake news outlets is crucial to combat misinformation's consequences. False narratives incite upheaval, fuel animosity, and mislead individuals. Robust penalties convey a resolute stance, safeguard the public, foster social harmony, and uphold responsible journalism. Holding media organizations accountable mitigates the pernicious impact, bolsters trust, and cultivates an enlightened society.
attributes.background: Government action needed: Penalize fake news media outlets, enforce stricter regulations, monitor for accuracy. Uphold journalistic standards, protect public trust. Ensure accountability in the media landscape.

rejection.details:
Ofcom already has a Broadcasting Code, which states that news, in whatever form, must be reported with due accuracy and presented with due impartiality: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/tv-radio-and-on-demand/broadcast-codes/broadcast-code/section-five-due-impartiality-accuracy

Investigating alleged breaches of the Code are the responsibility of Ofcom, not the Government or Parliament, and Ofcom has stated that when a broadcaster breaches the Code deliberately, seriously, repeatedly or recklessly, Ofcom may impose statutory sanctions against the broadcaster.
